critique: The document is an executive order that expands the authority of the Office of Defense Transportation. The tone is formal and authoritative. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and security that the government is taking necessary steps to manage domestic transportation during a time of war. There is no explicit mention of emotions, so I must infer them from the context and language. Joy is unlikely, as the context is serious. Sadness is also unlikely, as the order aims to improve efficiency. Anger is not the intention, but some may be angered by the expansion of government power. Fear is possible, as the order is related to wartime. Disgust is unlikely. Surprise is possible, depending on how expected the order was. Revised scores: Joy: 1, Sadness: 1, Anger: 2, Fear: 3, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 2
